title: The Global Remote Work Experiment of 2020
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Global Remote Work Experiment of 2020.

hook.text: In March 2020, billions went remote overnight. The largest work experiment in history â€” unplanned and forced.

buildup.text: Companies that said remote work was impossible made it work in days. The myth of office-only productivity shattered.

discovery.text: Productivity held or improved for most knowledge workers. But collaboration and culture suffered long-term.

twist.text: The experiment proved remote works. But it also revealed what offices actually provide: social bonds.

climax.text: Post-2020 work is being redesigned. The question shifted from 'can we?' to 'how should we?'

punchline.text: 2020 didn't invent remote work. It proved it at scale.

quiz.question: What did the 2020 remote work experiment prove?
options: Remote work is viable at scale but social bonds suffer
